alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 2:46PM MDT until March 31 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet from Wednesday night through Friday evening. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph before 3 AM Thursday. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of heavy precipitation alongside warmer temperatures will bring generally heavy, wet snowfall overnight Wednesday into Thursday. Terrain driven snow showers will continue through the day on Thursday, followed by another period of more widespread snowfall as a secondary energy source moves through the region. This second period will be accompanied by colder temperatures and better potential for road snow impacts.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
